definition: ribbon (as a decoration)/cordon (diagonal belt worn as a sign of office or honor)
band/belt/girdle/ribbon/tire/area/zone/region/CL:條|条[tiao2]/to wear/to carry/to take along/to bear (i.e. to have)/to lead/to bring/to look after/to raise
(bird species of China) Asian paradise flycatcher (Terpsiphone paradisi)/also called 壽帶|寿带[shou4 dai4]

sentences.english: Can you not understand that liberty is worth more than ribbons?
sentences.chinese: 你难道不明白自由比绶带更有价值吗？

sentences.english: He often wore a simple vest and a cylindrical, tasseled hat.
sentences.chinese: 他经常穿一件单薄的马甲，戴一顶有绶带的高帽。

sentences.english: We can see from the cyan and purple on the ribbon that he is of high rank.
sentences.chinese: 看那绶带上的青紫色，就知道他是高官显爵。

sentences.english: The ribbons knot together is homophonic to auspicious which means "everything goes well".
sentences.chinese: 绶带挽结的“结”与“吉”谐音，代表着吉祥如意。

sentences.english: He was wearing a military greatcoat with a single row of campaign ribbons.
sentences.chinese: 他身穿一件军大衣，上面挂着一排战功纪念绶带。

sentences.english: Horizontal pleating at empire waist with sash tie.
sentences.chinese: 在帝国腰水平能绶带的领带。

definition: armband (e.g. as part of uniform or to show status)
buttoned mandarin jacket of the Qing dynasty 清代[Qing1 dai4] (1644-1911)
official robe worn by ministers during the Ming 明 (1368-1644) and Qing 清 (1644-1911) dynasties
to drape sb in red silk as a sign of honor
